data.text: Wants to replace Assistant, but can't perform simple tasks. Can't do much as set a reminder with it, uninstalled within a minute of installing it. A great example of putting the cart before the horse. EDIT 03/03/2024: this functionality was present for a bit but now it's gone again. I'd given it 3 stars when it was working, but back to 1 star since it's now missing. Google really needs to get it's Assistant replacement to work as an assistant.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: ** update** So it works pretty good and I'm assuming it depends on your phone as well. I'm running it on Samsung Galaxy s21 Ultra. It does do the simple tasks like schedule reminders and alarms. It can open apps and search for video. It can easily plan a trip find all the cheapest flights and you just have to book it. I've noticed it doesn't always work and it looks like it switches between Google assistant and Gemini like two separate apps they quickly combined so I'm sure it will get better.

The app has become unresponsive and even the support email is no longer in service. How does this happen? The app had been working for a while. For those complaining about Gemini taking over assistant, that can be changed in the settings. I do agree Google should not have allowed that change without notifying users. The strange thing is now the app won't even load. I have cleared cache, storage, and even reinstalled the app. All I get is a blank black screen.

Really bad interface. To use it for anything it tells you to go to the app and change settings. But doesn't link or open it. Then when you attempt to change the setting, it gives instructions to go into another, different app to change other settings. All to set a reminder which apparently now I can't do anymore. How could they not test the most basic functionality??! I thought our best and brightest were at Google...
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: Understanding it's a experimental replacement for assistant. It still can't do as much as assistant can such as playing audio from an app. Additionally, although settings say it will use your location, it doesn't such as asking what the weather is gives weather for the incorrect location. It would also be nice if it read out loud the response automatically if the request was done via voice. If the request was done via voice, it may indicate the user needs to be hands-free.

Its Gemini on mobile! Seems to fail to talk sometimes. I also wish I could use the google assistant voices, as changing the setting doesn't seem to affect gemini. The app does currently support basic assistant commands like checking the weather, and opening apps. Could not get it to play a specific song on spotify. Map directions are good, but require an additional tap to access. When asked to go to my Dad's house (bookmarked), it directed me to my own. Some improvement is needed, but like it.

Not ready for prime time. As an assistant, it's horrible. It's so slow, can't perform assistant functions, requires unlock access even to say the weather, and only has the 1 robotic male voice option. As AI, it's sometimes good and other times straingly not AI...spitting out results that feel more like biased training than actual AI. Someday hopefully, but not yet. Unfortunately Google changes branding, app names, and software so often it's impossible to know what the hell is going on

I thought this would have been a nice upgrade/update to the assistant but I was wrong. It can't do anything the old assistant can do. something as simple as asking for the weather doesn't work. There is also another major flaw. I can use the badge to activate the assistant. I get the error of "That feature isn't available." On top of all this disabling Gemini is a multi step process that is hidden in multiple layers of settings.

I have certain destinations set up in all of my Google profiles (home, work etc). Gemini not only doesn't recognize they exist, it seems to be impossible to roll it back to the *functional* Google Assistant that I was using before. If I want to navigate home, I have to say my address or pull over, open maps, and put it in manually. Terrible roll out. Just inconvenient and awful.

UI is horrible for an assistant app. needs way more visual effects, needs to respond without opening whole app, needs to read created text as soon as it's creating, not after it. must have more access to system data and very larger control on device and home devices (like Google TV, else). it has a long way to become a successor to Google assistant... but we look forward to it.

Slow to respond. Do yourself a favor: don't ask it to navigate somewhere like you could with the previous Google Assistant. On multiple occasions I have asked it to navigate me to a local business and instead it will navigate me to a location literally hundreds of miles away and multiple states away (I asked it to navigate to the nearest Walgreens). Two stars because it can at least figure out how to start a timer with voice commands.

I've only ever preferred to view this as an "addition" or "subversive" aspect of the Google Assistant. Maybe by employing these LLVM features it coud do an even more expansive job. Unfortunately, it fails at times to even do to tasks Assistant does in a snap, and the ones it does do, are slower. I don't want it to wax poetic, it needs to order me some coffee while I'm driving!

Honestly this doesn't feel integrated enough with the assistant features to be useful yet as a "virtual assistant." It's can't set reminders, etc. I like the idea of being more conversational and actually engaging with dialogs but if it cannot also do the basics. I wouldn't recommend. EDIT 2/29/24 As the developer comment stated my issues with reminders and such have been fixed. My next issue is getting my Google assistant routines for my morning alarms. They help me a ton. But it's improving!
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: Can't perform simple tasks like set a timer or check on a timer. It's called advanced, but it is a very large step backwards. Naturally, the only way to disable it is through some convoluted steps in Google's clusterfu of a Home app, which I still have not located. Google needs to start listening to their users instead of just forcing changes on them. This is how you lose users

Where did the *Read Aloud* feature go? We NEED something that can visualize anything on your screen in any application, and read it out loud for anyone with learning disabilities, time management issues, hearing issues etc. it's easier for me to internalize, visualize and memorize anything that I HEAR vs READ! I am back in the stone age with Gemini and it's slowly destroying my relationship, duties and work, staying focused but aware of things around me so I can prioritize. I'm begging, plz

getting better and better now. very helpful. maybe enlarge the send button or add a bright background to make it easier to see? also instead of having to push the speaker key, have it read it right away? I am glad there is a speaker button though. Any way to make text larger within app? sometimes the answer will be completely wrong and inconsistent. I asked my app to send a task to the Devs because "he" told me he could not help. I suggested this and he said right I can. then he did so. 😀😀😀

Literally, I can't understand why someone thought it was a good idea to have to press a submit button after a voice prompt, where it then opens up an entire screen, where you then have to push a speaker button to hear the response. It's like Google suddenly knows nothing about what makes a good UX. It should be all in one go. If I'm prompting you with my voice, it should logically follow that I expect a audio response.

Gemini requires screen on for calls/texts, even with Extend Unlock enabled, limiting hands-free functionality. Inoperable unless set as the default assistant, restricting core features. Lacks integration with Google Search app and widget, forcing users to switch between apps for basic assistant features available with Google Assistant. These limitations hinder a comprehensive user experience. Updates for smoother operation and hands-free features are highly recommended.

PLEASE add a conversation mode for the assistant so i can talk to it without having to manually control the pace of talking to the model 🐬 This really needs more control over the system,it does less then the old assistant in terms of device control in some ways also It doesn't have controls for the voice, like when it activates. The tool essentially isn't as hands free friendly as it could be and in some ways as the standard assistant. The voice detection seems worse too.

Started out ok, but getting worse. Frustrating in the beginning that simple Assistant tasks couldn't be performed. Now it just crashes every time I use it. First thing this morning asked a question and got a too many requests error. Cleared data, cache, etc. Worked for one request then crashed again. Also respones are horribly slow. It's a shame that Microsoft Copilot is working so much better. Starting to feel suckered after latest announcement that Gemini Nano won't with on Pixel 8 Pro.

All of a sudden it stopped being able to identify the screen shots I was sharing with it and saying it is not able to see images on its screen. Even though the screen share feature is there and support.gemini says it can. Frustrating because it was helping me with an issue that I couldn't find on Google when searching for troubleshooting

it was better when you at least allowed images on places and things until you fix people image responses. some of the best most accurate images I wasn't expecting but on par with what I requested. also using other Google apps or device features like location, to answer the question "how many hours did I spend at a certain address this week?" should be a simple task if the program was actually self learning not just a token transformer. privacy response is an excuse, that's what permissions r 4.

It says that replacing the assistant is an opt-in feature, but the app can't be used without replacing the assistant. I wouldn't mind if the Gemini assistant could do basic stuff like setting reminders. Maybe I'll try it again some day. Update March 5 2024: The assistant can now do some of the basic tasks that I need. But, I still can not use the app if I choose to use the regular assistant.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: I like Gemini's AI chat capabilities, but as a replacement for Google Assistant it feels like a downgrade. For example, I am unable to ask it to take notes, which is a feature I commonly use while driving. I assume Google Assistant's features will be absorbed into Gemini as time goes on, but I will be switching back to Google Assistant for the time being.

I frequently use Gemini for it's chatbot features and have few problems with it, other than the fact that it is incredibly slow and clunky. My biggest issue is using it as a replacement for Google Assistant. It seems ridiculous to me that I have to turn on workplace extension to set reminders and interact with my calendar when I do not work anywhere. I really want the functionality of Google Assistant plus the features of Gemini without being forced to use workplace extension for no reason.

Really impressive. It acts as any other model, but even with Gemini advanced there's a lot of issues with taking in responses. Even trying to word it differently is a bit of a hassle sometimes. The app is a little buggy as well (it scrolls from the start initially), but I've enjoyed it overall.

This experience conversing with an llm is a huge improvement over the original Google Assistant, but there are so many things missing. The most frustrating for me is how it seems to randomly refuses to do home control.... And instead will tell you that if you want to control your lights, you need to have smart lights installed! Not working with routines is very frustrating. Inability to work with apps like Spotify is very inconvenient. Right now I am torn between using old and new.

Off to a great start but it needs to be more capable than assistant to replace assistant. I look forward to switching to this completely but it's missing commonly used features such as creating a calendar event, adding items to my shopping list, or playing the news (podcasts) are a must have for me. I would only continue to pay for pro after my trial ends if it has all the features Assistant has. Will drop back to a lower priced Google One tier until these features are added.

This is supposed to be the new Assistant... But it can't control any devices, can't activate routines. Basically it can't assist you with anything. It's a huge regression. Problem is, the early adopters and tech savvy are going to try it out, discover it's useless, and switch back to the normal Google Assistant. This got pushed out too early. It's Google Wave.

I was excited about this, but now I'm disappointed that they pushed this out before it was even close to ready. It is still unable to use so many of the features I use with Google Assistant. You can still switch back to the Assistant fairly easy, but this should not be marketed as the replacement if it can't even do what it needs to. (Like adding items to my shopping list) I look forward to when this gets a much needed update!

WHAT HAPPENED. I've been using Google assistance since the beginning and it's been amazing. But I can't even set a reminder now! The entire purpose of the assistant is to ASSIST. It won't set reminders, it won't open applications, it won't open settings. What's the point? Specifically the last update now I have to use Gemini instead of the old assistant and it can't do anything that I've been trying to get it to do. Please change it back so that I can use my voice to set reminders and tasks
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: Doesn't have the ability to play songs from Spotify. Somewhat neat but, despite having a lot of features, doesn't appear to have anything that Google Assistant can't already do. That's great it can compose an email but it still can't send it. It's weird how it can supposedly do more tasks than Assistant but I've found it actually doing less.

Good concept, but not ready. I like my Google Assistant much better. Google Assistant had access to everything that I like to do, and opened up the applications with no issues. I use Google Assistant in the car to make things much easier. I cannot use Gemini in the car as it will not play music, or make phone calls like the assistant will. Perhaps this will happen in the future, but for now, it is not ready.

not mature enough yet to be useful, and a straight down great and some regards to the simplistic home assistant. there's just some commands that doesn't know how to translate (setting reminders, turning off certain lights, etc) this technology should and will be the backbone of all future homes, but I'm surprised to see they've bungled the release so far, because I think the LLMs are capable enough, they're just not being used correctly. hopefully soon I'll be able to recommend this, not now

Not ready for general usage. Shouldn't be offered as an alternative to Google Assistant as Gemini has limited features such as cannot access location to do a simple ask such as "What time is it". Gemini is not useful for navigation since it can only give you verbal directions and a picture of the map, but doesn't start navigation for you. This is an inconvenience when driving and trying to be handsfree. Needs more work before being a viable alternative to Google Assistant.
data.replyText: Thanks for your feedback! Now when you ask for directions Gemini will automatically start navigation with Google Maps. Give it a try and let us know what you think!

data.text: Do you want a hamstrung Google Assistant with only 50% of the functionality? Do you want your assistant widgets to lose functionality in favor of an app that's not fully developed so Google can try and maintain a sense of competition in a market they're not ready for yet? Then you're in the right place. This LLM has potential I guess, but nothing innovative so far. Very limited interface with phone and apps. Significantly reduced function compared to assistant. Stick with assistant.

Breaks so many features because either there is a bug or the features are not implemented. Screenshot with power and volume are gone, Android Auto Assistant settings return 403 on the pages, Google Home broadcast and other features are not working. if Gemini replaces the old assistant the feature parity need to be there before the switch. From a capability standpoint, the lack of access to return current results is annoying such as looking for and retrieving photos from WikiCommons and wikidata.

you can't even use it as a chatbot without replacing assistant. wow. I'd rather have a decent assistant than this garbage anyway. guess I'll stick to gpt for chats and assistant for assistance. all it does is give you answers. asking it to call someone is hit or miss and asking it to map you somewhere will give you the Zillow on the house. asking it to play a playlist on YT Music will just give you a list of playlists. stick with Google Assistant for controlling your phone. this is useless.

The AI itself seems fairly solid. Unfortunately, it is not a replacement for Google assistant and that seems to be the only way to use the app; to "opt in" to it replacing the assistant on your phone. Until it is either stand alone where Gemeni can be used without replacing the assistant (similar to the ChatGPT app) or is a viable replacement for the assistant (e.g. being able to accomplish the most basic tasks in Google home or even make a reminder) this app is useless.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: Settings refused to turn on "Hey Google" until over 10 attempts later. Still won't respond if the screen is locked even though I selected to allow it to. Can generate AI images but nothing with people. Can't perform "Hey Google play music" request. Can't change the voice to a different voice model. It's completely useless at this point.

On day one, when I hit my phone's assistant hotkey, Gemini would wake up *and* listen for my voice; it wouldn't auto-submit and I had to hit a button to send that query, but when it landed Gemini would play the answer using TTS. Now it doesn't listen unless I click the microphone; it does auto-submit when I pause, but then it won't speak unless I find the speaker button. Can you PLEASE just get these basics right?!

i love the kind of information this assistant can provide, and would prefer it, except you can't do anything with it in lockscreen. little things like asking for the time or asking to turn on my lamp. also, when asking for directions somewhere it unnecessarily complicates it and requires you to use your hands to open up maps and to click on the right location which is hard to do while driving. the original assistant was completely hands free and made navigation easy and you didn't have to unlock

I can't add anything to my shopping list I can't navigate anywhere I can't do anything except have a conversation. I can't turn on my lights I can't change the volume on my television or control my media. All of the assistant features of assistant have disappeared. This app keeps putting itself back onto my phone even when I delete it. My assistant is completely gone. as much as I hate Apple I think I'm going to move to the Apple ecosystem. This might be a great program but it's not an assistant

Can't even use the regular Google Assistant functions like adding to a shopping list for example or hearing what an animal sounds like. It will explain things in simple terminology if you ask it to and write out this or that. But the lack of the Assistant functionality did not even make me want to use it much more than for just a novelty. Uninstalled and disabled on my device because it just takes over anything I would normally do with Google Assistant, which I do use a lot.

While it may be cool to have an AI tool to search for stuff or write an email or look up a recipe on my computer Having Gemini as Google Assistant on my phone (Pixel 7 Pro) is not productive at all. I can't schedule a meeting automatically in Calendar, it can't automatically navigate to location I request in Google Maps, it can't play music I request automatically, it can't put a reminder in Keep. Not a very useful assistant.

Randomly popped up to replace Google Assistant, tried it out & I have to say it is unbelievably unreliable. Google Assistant is/was way better. Plus what was all that stuff in the news about the AI making racial Nazis? Much rather have assistant than this trash. Oh & best part, if you try to uninstall it, it just pops back up & you're only allowed disabled it at that point instead. So basically forcing you to use it. Thanks Google, you lose massive brownie points for this one.

This app is not very user-friendly when it comes to hands-free. The home button doesn't work either. While its responses are infinitely better than Google Assistant in terms of actually getting answers, pretty much all of its other functionality is lacking. Maybe if there's a way to merge Gemini with assistant, it would be more enjoyable to

Downloaders beware! The app has stopped working. When I open it, I just get a black screen. Have tried force stopping and uninstalling and reinstalling. What's worse, even after deleting it, I no longer have access to Assistant. This has really impacted the function of my phone and I hope it gets resolved soon.

Wanted to like it. Reckon I eventually will. As it stands, it's worse than Assistant. In addition to limitations mentioned by other commenters, I'll add that the old Assistant would allow you to, hands-free, ask it to take a note and it'd put it in Google Keep for you to work with later. As it stands now, it can't put a note anywhere but in the record of the conversation. I'll likely rollback until they get it sorted.

I hate Google Gemini because I'm tired of AI in general. For me the novelty wore off months ago and now I'm just sick of AI. It's not that impressive. I want an assistant that can open and close apps, read web articles out loud, and change the settings on my phone. I'm very angry that Google Gemini was rolled out as a replacement when it doesn't even have the same functionality as Google Assistant. It doesn't do anything that I ask and just makes my life more complicated.

Does not feel like an advantage over using the web version. Feels like a step backwards in terms of phone functionality. In addition with the change from bard to Gemini the ai responses are significantly altered to be much more muted and "safe" I used to be able to use this to research or converse about research find journals and discuss their findings now I cannot do so without being read a sorry I can't do that it's not safe

It takes 6 times longer to do anything. I asked Google Assistant what time it was - 2 seconds to respond. I asked Gemini the same question - 11.5 seconds. That's on top of it not having reminders, not being able to take you to contacts addresses, and the inability to use assistant until all of these things get implemented. Gemini already falls back to Assistant for some requests - it would not be that hard to program it to do the same for everything else missing. I'm excited, but it's not there.

I love the idea of Gemini instead of Google assistant. Unfortunately, it is too primitive and early to effectively use it. I can't set calendar events, play music, and other basic features of google assistant. With time, it will improve. But, I can't recommend it at this stage.

It was solid enough at launch relative to the other AI models IMO. I upgraded immediately to Advanced via Google One promo - 2 month free trial. ★ Was Immediately impressive. Gemini Advanced is vastly superior & incredibly intuitive. Huge difference from basic version. The Overkill censorship of Bard & other big AI chat bots seems minimal & hasn't stopped researching tricky subjects. If so, an explanation why can be given which allows for reframing prompts. Noticeably improving consistently.

I've been in the Google ecosystem since it's inception and wanted something simple to replace Assistant, since it feels like Assistant has gotten worse. Even with all the extensions turned on, Gemini can't. "Add X to my shopping list" or "take a note" becomes "I can't do that" or "here's a response to what you asked me to take as a note". Forced unlocking the phone every time? Get out of here. I'll switch back to assistant and then Alexa / Siri if Gemini doesn't get better

Gemini Advance still has some improving to do, considering I'm paying good money on a monthly basis for it. Based on my experience, it has problems differentiating between real and imaginary. It cannot provide simple URLs from a search. You go around in circles if you try to ask complex questions. My advice, start simple and work toward the complex. With all the hype with AI, I was expecting a much better experience. Stars: 2 and 1/2.

DO NOT DOWNLOAD YET!!! It didn't work well and i wanted to uninstall and resume using google assistant. Unfortunately, it seems to have modified my google assistant somehow... and I've lost the delightful function I've been used to. I'm sure it will get better, but presently it's way beta!! If you rely on assistant on your phone, DO NOT INSTALL!!

so good so far, but I don't like that I manually have to hit the speaker button each time to hear the audio response. instead of it just being a simple back and forth. that adds significantly too much friction and dependency on physically touching the phone which then defeats the purpose of having a more advanced assistant.

This app is not ready to replace assistant. not even close. As a LLM it gives incorrect information in nearly every reply. The accuracy is much lower than ChatGPT or Copilot. As an assistant it fails a bunch of tasks and has to hand off others to the original assistant. There are no voice customization settings either so the bad male speech to text voice is what you're stuck with. This needed 6 more months to bake in the lab before being released as a beta product.

I was excited to have an AI assistant feature on my new phone, but this app was obviously pushed out before it was ready. Frustrating, unintuitive, and not capable of doing even the most basic stuff that an assistant should be able to do. Maybe it will be cool eventually, but right now it's embarrassingly bad.

Hey Google no longer works on lock screen even though setting has been enabled. For example, hey Google what time is it?... No longer works and asks you to unlock the phone first. Another issue is unable to create calendar events. For example: Hey Google create event for this date... Unable to perform task. Too many bugs I want to roll back to Google Assistant.

Gemini is not ready to replace the old assistant. I guess it has cool new capabilities now but really, when I use my assistant 20 times a day it's for simple stuff like setting a reminder or playing a song. Edit: updating to 3* as gemini can now set reminders. I like how extensions work and hope to see spotify added soon.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: works well for the most part. I test it against chat gpt regularly and get similar results. from a business perspective sometimes I prefer the Gemini output. But I'm not sure I can use it as a replacement for Google assistant yet. I've found myself frustrated several times with the results or lack thereof in situations where Google assistant would have handled it like a champ.

Some things are cool, but they also lost some super useful features from the old Google Assistant. In particular for me, I miss the ability to translate directly onscreen (similar to Google Lens, where it directly overlays the original text). Adding this back to Gemini would be fantastic (for me, anyway)

So I enjoy it but I can't recommend the app because it replaces Google assistant and it loses a bunch of functionality. Reminders, being able to broadcast to your home speakers, issues with different apps, etc. I do enjoy Gemini, but I'll have to use it through the browser until they can fix the functionality.

digital assistants have been around for years now, and every year they get better at what they do. setting alarms and reminders, entering calendar events are common examples. to me Generative AI should be a game changer. An Executive Assistant so to speak. it should help me make better decisions by giving me the most relevant data and data from reliable sources. in the second generation AI, often my inquiry comes back with the disclaimer of I'm an LLM only.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: So far it's good however the voice response time is considerably slower than the good old Google Assistant and also it cannot perform all the tasks that a regular assistant could. when I asked about the current weather, it showed the weather information on the screen but did not prompt the voice which is kinda a shame. Speech-to-text is also not as accurate as on the regular Google Assistant. It frequently misspells or replaces completely new words than what I said.

While it's fun to play with, the inability to use it with a lock screen for a hands-free experience while driving ruins it the most. The second is that asking for the time is impossible because it can't use your location data. Even with basic functions, this makes Google assistant a better choice at this time. I do hope Gemini improves, but it can't replace assistant without these abilities.

I wanted to like this... Google released this app too early. The concept is excellent but delivery is poor. There's so much missing here, mainly with the assignment features. Google Assistant was working great: it listened better, automatically opened apps (like Google Maps, when I ask for directions for instance), had continued conversation, and read responses back to me without me having to press a small button. I'm sure this will get better but right now it's pretty bad.

Here I am dropping yhe raiting again. I really wanted to like this. I'm on a Galaxy s23 Ultra, and the responses take no less than 8 seconds. Most of the features I used in the assistant are broken or just gone entirely. For example, you can't ask it to play music anymore without having to interact with the screen. I want to remove Gemeni from my phone, but even after uninstalling Gemini, it's still taking over my phone. I no longer want to be a part of what is essentially a beta test of AI.

Replaced my assistant button, and can't identify songs. Sometimes Now Playing doesn't catch a song, so I pull up assistant for help, which it always does. I had to use Gemini for this today and it keeps saying it can't do it. It even said "I can't use the mic yet...". This app is NOT READY. **EDIT: I found the option to switch back to Assistant. But I don't like the fact Gemini took over for my Assistant without my approval. I have had the app on my phone for a month and it just did that today.

it is not true ai like perplexity tool, looks like, it just aggregate internet from other websites text rewriting. it is all surface level work. that is why, it is sometimes biased or something, too scar to answer, if the keyword lead to a sensitive topic, it can be solved by get the context and break the writings with respect to both side of the story and summaries, google engineering looks like getting lazzy .

Edit: dropped to one star for image generation fiasco currently still having issues with basic Google assistant commands, like asking it to navigate to a location, it pulls up an image of the map and link to Google maps, it needs to be fluid and automatically start navigation or at least a single button to start. with the forced replacement of Google Assistant, I tried asking it to play a song and it just sent links to YouTube videos and custom made commands

It excels and the art of generating stories and just brainstorming ideas; but it lacks in the field of generating images, answering your questions or delimmas on the first try and very limited when it comes to trying to get the answer, forcefully or through loops. Reminds me of a very organized and easy-to-use Google search. But like I said, it writes stories and gives you ideas much better than Chat-GPT or the other off-brand Ai's. All in all, I love it and I am very hopeful for Gemini Ai.

well it's in the beginning stages it's not exactly perfect as the original Google Assistant but I'm sure they're working on it more and more. what I don't like is it doesn't take me directly to an address or location I ask it to like the original assistant. but I'm sure future updates will fix this I believe Gemini is the future by the looks of it 🤘🤘💥

I wanted to change the voice when I opted in to try the Gemini integrated with Google Assistant. It seems the direction Google is going so I wanted to get to know the new version of the product. I asked if I can change the voice settings, it said yes but that it can't change the settings for me, but if I ask it can open it. I asked it to open the assistant settings, and it told me it can't alter settings and to ask to open it. Maybe Google should develop BEFORE release. Dumb. Embarrassing.

I love Google (pretty much everything), while it's not always perfect it often very good and user friendly. Gemini is not good as an AI... Even an outdated model of ChatGPT is far more advanced while Gemini feels as though it is still in its early stages of development. 🤷 As far as an assistant, it can't handle anything Google Home related and thus not a replacement for Google Assistant. Ironic that it has 4.1 stars but when you look there's nothing but 1, 2, or 3 stars ratings. 😅

This app is poor. Aside from just being slow it also produces very biased results and images. Which is making me think about my use of Google at all. They have built an agenda into their algorithms should not exist and it is unfortunate. Leaving the Google world will be a challenge. But there are other search engines, other email providers, other operating systems, and more. The "errors" they claim are accidental seem to be across the board and it makes me wonder what else they manipulate.

so far, the app works extremely well. I haven't had any app crashes for anything. sometimes, there are a little inconsistencies in its performance. but overall, it works pretty good. I have an experienced any of the negatives with Gemini that others are reporting.

Completely murdered all my assistant functions, I can no longer listen to the news or control any of my Device groups. I will wait until they integrate assistant or put back to the assistant features before I reinstall. The AI photo generation feature is extremely fun, I will probably continue to use it on the website so that it doesn't screw up my daily workflows

so many things wrong with this app. has this been tested in real life before release. 1. response rate is really slow. 2. simple questions like what time is it? takes like 10 sec for response. opens a new page. 3. lacks auto audio response. had to tap audio to hear it.

It's great to finally have a dedicated app! Definitely could have used some more testing though. I replaced Google Assistant with Gemini on my Pixel 8 Pro and the experience was initially lackluster to say the least. The biggest annoyance was that I had to hit "send" for all types of commands ("open ", "call X", "tell me about"). This has been fixed with the latest update, which came about pretty quickly, and I can now truly replace assistant with Gemini. There are some quirks to still work out.

A step in the right direction but the lack of feature parity with Google Assistant leaves it severely handicapped. I agree with the other reviewers but it was the inability to run a home automation routines with my morning alarm that is causing me to switch back to Google Assistant. I'll definitely be back in a few months to see how things are progressing.

I love the idea behind of this. The Bard rebranding makes it feel more official. And having an app finally is incredible. It being able to replace your Google Assistant is amazing as well. Albeit, with some current early-adopter downfalls. The "Check your Internet connection" error pops up often for no reason at the moment. Also, used as an assistant, it disables the vocal responses. It opens the app on responses, instead of being native. And the word recognition is a little strange at times.

Google should embarrassed. To use this app, you must let it take the place of Assistant, or you can't even get into it. But, it can't do the most basic tasks of Assistant. It can't set reminders, for example. And if you want to navigate in maps, it takes three clicks after it brings up the results before you are navigating, making it useless and dangerous to use while driving, while Assistant is 100% voice. In short, it is a pretty mediocre chatbot that kills your Assistant to use.

works well but missing features. if I wanted the newest version, I can't use it on the app and it can be frustrating to have to open the web browser just to do it. the prompts I have already searched are also not the greatest, being tiny font at the bottom. bigger buttons you can click would be helpful.

It's obviously a work in progress, but it is definitely not ready for prime time. There are too many features missing for gemini to replace google assistant. I wanted to like it and tried, but I gave up. Also, I saw several examples of innaccurate/incorrect info, answers that the regular assistant gets right consistently. If you rely on assistant and accurate answers, don't waste your time ... yet. Also, don't pay for it ... at least ... not right now.

It's not terrible, but not ready to replace Google Assistant. Several important features are missing. For example, I asked it to play the news and got a long description saying it can't do that. Looking forward to seeing how it evolves but Assistant is still my go to. I also think $20 a month for advanced features is way too much. Google needs to re-evaluate their subscription pricing. I don't subscribe to youtube music because its too expensive for a family plan and wont be for this.

It was good while it worked, not great, but still good. Now, my Gemini app is just a blank, empty screen, does not get fixed on force stopping the app or closing it. I don't feel like an assistant should require restarting your phone to be functional if it fails. The UI is great, and Gemini is very useful, but the interaction does not compare to Google Assistant yet.

Much worse functionality than Google assistant and it doesn't do any better at understand what I'm saying. I can't control smart devices. It won't launch apps on my phone (like play a song). Every time I launch it with a hey Google command it doesn't register anything I say. I have to press a button to make it listen. I tried to turn it off and switch back to Google assistant, but now assistant is broken. I was initially excited, but an upgrade shouldn't remove my most commonly used features.

Maps needs to just go. If I'm asking Google to take me somewhere, I would like it to automatically open Maps or at least show a countdown before doing so. Currently in Google Assistant with Gemini, I have to click the small maps button to open maps, which I shouldn't have to do for a voice command that is used while driving. Otherwise, this upgrade seems like it will be for the better. Maps for example has a great integration other than the above issue, as it displays trip time and mileage.

Very cool, but some half-baked features and bugs prevent it from being show ready just yet. Mostly, it falls down because it's trying to replace assistant while not elegantly handling the feature set. Its integration with Google maps is still very poor, activating it from locked screen often results in the voice prompt being lost when unlocked, and it goes on very verbose tangents about things that needed a succinct answer. Gemini is going to be really cool. Just not quite an assistant yet.

Google is too large of a company to put out rushed "beta" releases that are so buggy and poorly thought out. If you try to integrate it in as your default assistant, you end up losing assistant features. On day one that meant you had to hit send before a voice command would go through, but they fixed that. Currently reminders don't work, I have to unlock my phone to control smart devices that I previously didn't have to, and the voice is different from my assistant setting, etc ... Disabled.

Overall, it's just a serious downgrade from the assistant. It's frustrating that it replaces the assistant as a " More capable advanced AI," yet chickens out on the most basic functions. Google just emphasize the sweet thing called circle the search, but with the AI, it won't search anything with a person in it. So any article of clothing that someone is wearing, I can't search, because there's someone wearing it. A sloppy unfinished replacement that's actually less useful.

If you intend on Gemini being a fully featured assistant that replaces the Google Assistant, it would be good to ensure that Gemini has all the features of your previous Assistant. For example, I wanted to know if I had a calendar event and it could not access my calendar. I wanted it to identify a song, but it couldn't do that, I wanted it to open the battery settings directly instead of having to ask it to open the settings and clicking on battery. Basic stuff that Assistant has.

1. To use this app, I have to let it replace Google Assistant. I cannot just use it as a chat bot. There is a setting in the app that lets me go back to Google Assistant. But then the app resets. Terrible decision! 2. For use as an assistant app, it's missing a lot of features like it doesn't have routines, it cannot play music on my music app, it cannot add things to my shopping list, it cannot give voice responses, it cannot do anything offline, etc.

As an LLM, it might be a step forward, but as an assistant it's a huge step back. It really has no business replacing Google Assistant at this point, as it can't do basic things that assistant has done for over a decade. And if you disable assistant integration, it'll take it over the next time you open it. Absolutely mind-boggling that it was released like this.

Edit: I reinstalled it. (It's so smart.) Except: Gemini can set alarms, but can't set tasks. I use this with my assistant quite a bit "set a reminder for 1pm called start dinner." Etc. But it seems like the app disabled this function entirely. I use this to talk to my Google Assistant multiple times per day. There was no way to change it back now.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback - you can now use your voice to set reminders and calendar entries with the Gemini app by enabling the Workspace Extension in the Gemini app settings. See more details here: https://support.google.com/gemini/answer/14579631#workspace_extension

data.text: I can only use it if I make it my "hey google" assistant, but original assistant is not broken. Whereas Gemini doesn't navigate driving, rather it will give you info about your destination, unless you interact with it several times first. So now if I turn it off as assistant, and if I want to try to use it for other features, it makes me re-agree to terms of service which automatically re-assigns itself as the main assistant. I can't use its other features without it being in charge of assisting

Absolutely worthless for any on device tasks. It's basically a neutered search with extremely limited functionality. Asking for a basic timer to be set gives you a text reading of how to manually set it!?!? Why? Just set it like the assistant before it did. This actually adds extra work instead of being useful in any meaningful way. No productivity gain, no pleasure and no fun.
